image.altText: A picture of two women superimposed together

props.synopsis: The pair arrangement between two Liberal MPs with differing views was considered crucial, given the vote on a late-term abortion bill was expected to be tight.

title.children: How a pear-shaped pair exposed fractures within the SA Liberal Party

image.altText: A red sky looms over horizon far away. Dirt road with worksite alongside it.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says a possible tornado could have caused the extensive power outage in far west New South Wales as SA's Energy Minister confirms mining operations at Olympic Dam will be down for up to a week following storms in SA's north.

title.children: Broken Hill hit by 'possible tornado', as storms affect mining operations at Olympic Dam

image.altText: A grey US B-2 stealth bomber attack aircraft seen flying through the rear entry of another military plane.

props.synopsis: The Department of Defence has confirmed Australia provided support for US strikes on October 17, targeting the Houthi facilities "through access and overflight for US aircraft in northern Australia".

title.children: Australian air bases helped with the major US strike on Houthi weapon stores

image.altText: A man with a green ribbon over his shoulders putting his hands in the air

props.synopsis: Along with the celebrations in Israel, there will be Gazans experiencing some relief and hope after his killing. The greatest thing to come from his death would be if it were the last in Gaza from this war.

title.children: Yahya Sinwar was Israel's enemy number one. What happens now that he's gone?

image.altText: Carol Clay in a kitchen wearing CWA apron

props.synopsis: Murderer Greg Lynn is sentenced to 32 years' jail for shooting camper Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country four years ago.

title.children: Teary judge jails former pilot for 'brutal, horrific' death of Victorian camper Carol Clay

image.altText: A man in a safari suit and a woman in a white dress walk on a red rock

props.synopsis: Charles and Diana's tour of Australia helped win back the hearts and minds of the monarch's subjects, but it was also where their relationship was forever altered.

title.children: King Charles and Queen Camilla are visiting Australia. In 1983, his tour with Diana was 'utterly traumatic'

image.altText: Heavy rain floods highways and restaurants in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms have caused flash flooding across Victoria, cutting major roads and inundating some properties.

title.children: Major Melbourne roads flooded as storms sweep across the state

image.altText: Carl Ditterich leaving court

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court has heard the alleged incidents related to one teenage girl and took place in the south-east Melbourne suburb of Moorabbin in 1985.

title.children: Former footballer Carl Ditterich to stand trial over historic sexual assault allegations

image.altText: Five men dressed in formal suits stand on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Liam Payne's family say they're "heartbroken", and paid tribute to the former One Direction member's "kind, funny and brave soul" after he was found dead in Buenos Aires.

title.children: 'We love you Liam': One Direction members pay tribute to former bandmate Liam Payne

image.altText: PJ Harvey performs live on stage at the State Theatre on January 18, 2012 in Sydney, Australia.

props.synopsis: Two-time Mercury-award-winning artist PJ Harvey will bring her live show to Australia for the first time in eight years for WOMADelaide.

title.children: PJ Harvey, Nils Frahm and more announced on WOMADelaide 2025 line up

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering three people allegedly threatened a fellow inmate last year by telling him he would make him "number four", a court has heard.

title.children: 'I'll make you number four': Accused serial killer made threat, court hears

image.altText: Two oval containers with white pouches and golden pouches on a background of yellow and orange graphic.

props.synopsis: Teens say an illegal nicotine product is easy to procure, leaving experts calling for better enforcement.

title.children: These products make you 'very sick' and 'lethargic' so why are teens turning to it?

image.altText: Two women crying while hugging a baby boy.

props.synopsis: An infant was allegedly sold by his father to a married couple desperate to have children in one of the latest cases of baby trafficking in Indonesia.

title.children: 'I want my husband to be punished': Indonesian police say a dad sold his 11-month-old baby to fund gambling

image.altText: A waterway closed over by sand.

props.synopsis: A freak storm brought nearly 100,000 cubic metres of sand into the entrance of Cape Jaffa's marina, but the South Australian government says it can't help the local council.

title.children: Popular marina closed off by enough sand to fill nearly 40 Olympic pools

image.altText: A rocket flies over farmland

props.synopsis: A Canadian company has signed a deal to test its rocket in South Australia next year. If successful, it will be the first time a rocket reaches space from the remote Koonibba base.

title.children: Tiny South Australian town to host first rocket launch to space

image.altText: A woman in a bike helmet with brown hair rides her bike in the country.

props.synopsis: Lisa Millar returns to her hometown of Kilkivan to learn about its new rail trail and is reminded the decline of these small country towns doesn't have to be a permanent trend.

title.children: How do you give a dying town a second life? The answer for Lisa Millar's childhood home was a rail trail

image.altText: A close-up of Lia Finocchiaro as she addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The NT's new Country Liberal Party government has passed legislation to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10. It comes just a day after the government pushed through tougher bail laws and extra powers for police.

title.children: NT passes law to lower age of criminal responsibility to 10 years old

image.altText: a photo taken from a plane window shows a thin river with lots of twists and turns, and native vegetation on the bank.

props.synopsis: A long stretch of the Murray River and the massive Macquarie Marshes wetland in NSW could soon be designated "threatened ecological communities" by the federal government. Here's what that means.

title.children: Part of an iconic Australian river could soon be on the 'critically endangered' list

image.altText: Orange logo of brand Temu displayed on a phone

props.synopsis: CHOICE purchased and tested 15 toys at random from Temu, with most carrying deadly coin and button battery hazards. Every product failed safety testing against Australian regulations.

title.children: Deadly hazards found in Temu products spark calls for 'rebooted' consumer safety laws

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: Secret Service personnel displayed a "troubling" lack of critical thinking as to the risk posed to the former president in the lead-up to the July assassination attempt, an independent review finds.

title.children: 'No-one from the Secret Service' told Donald Trump's protection detail about potential assassin, report finds

image.altText: Sukhdeep and her daughter Ravneet Kaur. Ravneet stands behind Sukhdeep and embraces her.

props.synopsis: Sukhdeep Kaur moved to Australia on a temporary work visa. But things quickly unravelled when her employer was barred from sponsoring migrant workers.

title.children: Migrant employee facing deportation after employer breached sponsorship obligations

image.altText: A mangled grain silo amid a huge pile of spilled wheat on the bank of a river.

props.synopsis: Two silos collapsed at Manildra's plant at Bomaderry, NSW overnight, spewing thousands of tonnes of wheat neat the Shoalhaven River. Authorities say a third silo containing 500 tonnes of wheat has been badly damaged and an exclusion zone has been set up.

title.children: 30m-high silo falls into river after double collapse, third in jeopardy amid massive wheat spill

image.altText: a man sitting at a computer

props.synopsis: For years, ATO investigators have been trawling the social media accounts of possible tax cheats looking for evidence of hidden lavish lifestyles. Now they're looking to automate the process.

title.children: Australian Taxation Office hopes to scrape social media, dark web with new tool against tax cheats

image.altText: A close-up photograph of several black balls washed up on sand with lapping water in the background.

props.synopsis: It's time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Politicians with property portfolios, a bold starship test and mysterious balls surface on Sydney beaches

image.altText: A photo of Todd Mengaldo in a hoodie kneeling down.

props.synopsis: Detectives investigating the death of Andrew Truman in Melbourne's CBD last week have confirmed he and the man wanted over the fatal assault were known to each other. Police are still searching for Todd Menegaldo in relation to the assault.

title.children: Police confirm link between Melbourne CBD assault victim and wanted man

image.altText: Three men in suits smiling.

props.synopsis: Research prepared for the United States Congress argues Australia could abandon its $368 billion AUKUS push to buy nuclear-powered submarines.

title.children: Congressional report suggests Australia could dump plans to acquire AUKUS nuclear submarines

image.altText: Flight Centre sign at shopfront at South Bank in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A day after setting a new record high, the Australian share market ended lower on Friday after data confirmed China's economy was still losing steam despite the country ramping up its economic stimulus packages.

title.children: ASX 200 retreats from record high as Flight Centre nosedives and China's economy slows — as it happened

image.altText: A colourful close up photo of a brine shrimp

props.synopsis: Extreme close-ups of a mouse brain, octopus eggs and slime mould are among this year's Small World entries from 80 countries. Here are the judges' favourites.

title.children: Our tiny world in photos: The top 15 images from the 2024 photomicroscopy competition

image.altText: A man with short grey hair smiles looking at the camera against a white background

props.synopsis: Craig Laidley has not been seen since he was swept out to sea after saving a struggling swimmer at a Bali beach.

title.children: Fears for Australian man missing in Bali after rescuing tourist in 'extreme' conditions

image.altText: A doctor measures a patient's waist in her office.

props.synopsis: Despite widespread criticism, BMI continues to be the go-to for measuring some health risks. Now the "body roundness index" is gaining traction as a viable alternative. What's stopping it being used?

title.children: Why measuring body 'roundness' could be a better indicator of health than BMI

image.altText: A man and two women in formal attire smile for the camera.

props.synopsis: The passing of the Equality Bill allows transgender people to change their birth certificates without having to underdo surgery, and falls in line with other state and territories.

title.children: 'A big step forward': Bill expanding transgender rights passes NSW parliament

image.altText: Peter Dutton, wearing a suit and tie, glares from his seat in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is well-placed for next year's election, but the looming battle over industrial relations could be more dangerous for Peter Dutton than his risky gamble to promote nuclear energy.

title.children: Whatever his policy, Peter Dutton will be a big target on workplace relations

image.altText: Andrew Barr press conference

props.synopsis: Just over half of the 213 policies that have been submitted for costing by the three biggest parties have been costed so far.

title.children: Here's what the ACT's major parties plan to spend if they're elected tomorrow

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's stomach as she lifts up her white shirt and places an MHT patch on the side of her stomach.

props.synopsis: Having recovered from some misreporting around increased breast cancer risk in the early 2000s, menopause hormone therapy, once known as HRT, is having a resurgence.

title.children: Menopausal hormone therapy has made a 'comeback'. What is it and is it right for you?

image.altText: Southern right whales mating

props.synopsis: A mating frenzy captured on camera off Western Australia's south coast is a promising sign for southern right numbers still recovering from decades of whaling, according to a marine biologist.

title.children: Whale mating 'orgy' off Australian coast a promising sign for southern right species
